qa_pairs.question: Sa ilalim ng pamumuno ni MacArthur, sino ang naging pinunong naglingkod noong 1946?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Si Manuel Roxas, na naging isang mahahalagang personalidad sa kasaysayan ng Pilipinas, ay naging pangulo at nagtatag ng Liberal Party noong 1946. Siya ang unang pinuno ng Pilipinas na naglingkod mula pa noon.

qa_pairs.question: Who was the president of the Philippines after winning the presidency and vice-presidency of the Commonwealth in April of 1946?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Manuel Roxas, who led the Liberal Party to victory and became the first president of the newly formed republic under the postcolonial dispensation.

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang nangyari sa mga sumisikop sa pagkolonyadong Hapon mula sa Pilipinas?
qa_pairs.answer: Pinatawag ng Amerika ang amnesty para sa mga nananatiling kolaborador.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang pagpatawag ng amnesty ni Roxas ay isang taktika upang makabawi sa mga naging sumikod sa pamahalaan noong panahon ng pananakop, na marami sa kanila ay kasapi rin ng maharlikang pamilya. Ang aksyon ni Roxas ay nagpapahiwatig ng paghambing sa pagitan ng mga nanalo at nawalan ng kapangyarihan.

qa_pairs.question: Who led the Philippine Expeditionary Force to Korea (PEFTOK) during the Korean War?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: President Elpidio Quirino, who was the President of the Philippines at that time and authorized the sending of the Philippine Expeditionary Force to Korea (PEFTOK), demonstrating the country's commitment to its alliance with the United States during the Cold War.

qa_pairs.question: Paano nagkaroon ng mga base ang Estados Unidos sa Pilipinas noong 1947?
qa_pairs.answer: Sa pamamagitan ng pag-isyu ng Military Bases Agreement (MBA)
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Sa pamamagitan ng pag-isyu ng Military Bases Agreement (MBA), na nagbigay-diin sa kundisyon ng mga base at kontrol ng Estados Unidos sa mga lugar na ito, nangongontra ito sa karapatan ng bansa sa pagpapanatili ng kaayusan ng pulitika at seguridad.

qa_pairs.question: Who was the general who lived in a magnificent penthouse with seven air-conditioned rooms at the luxurious Manila Hotel?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Dwight Eisenhower's successor, General Douglas MacArthur, enjoyed demigod status and a lavish lifestyle during his tenure in the Philippines, symbolizing the complex and often contentious relationship between American colonial powers and Filipino society.
qa_pairs.context:

cast	the	Philippines	in	a	new	light.	Touted	as	America’s	showcase	of	democracy
in	Asia,	the	newly	independent	nation	had	to	be	kept	free	of	Communism.	The

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang turing na pagpapala ng Estados Unidos sa Pilipinas noong digmaan?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang pagpapala ay naging isyu ng pakikibaka para sa karapatan at kasarinlan ng Pilipinas, na pinangunahan ng mga sundalong Huk na nagtataguyod ng pagbabago at kalayaan ng bansa.

qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Air Force Colonel Edward Lansdale, a key figure in implementing counterinsurgency tactics and 'hearts-and-minds' strategy, which reflects the complex cultural dynamics between American influence and Philippine social realities.

qa_pairs.question: Paano natulungan ng dating Pangulo ang mga rebelde?
qa_pairs.answer: Sa pamamagitan ng paggamit ng propaganda at mga programa sa panloob na pag-unlad.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Sa pamamagitan ng paggawa ng unang epekto ng propaganda at mga programa sa panloob na pag-unlad, kasama ang paggamit ng mga katutubong alamat tulad ng aswang upang matakot ang mga rebelde. Ito ay isang halimbawa ng pakikibaka sa loob ng isipan at pangkalahatang estratehiya ng dating Pangulo na nakakuha ng suporta ng karamihan sa kapulisan.

qa_pairs.question: Who was the president that died in a plane crash on March 17, 1957?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Rodrigo Duterte's predecessor and one of the most beloved presidents in Philippine history, Ramon Magsaysay, who embodied the Filipino values of humility and dedication to public service. His untimely death on March 17, 1957, shocked the nation, but his legacy lives on as a symbol of what it means to be a true Filipino leader.

qa_pairs.question: Saang partido si Senator Claro M. Recto nanloko?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang Nationalist Citizens Party, na pinaniniwalaang nagtataglay ng malalim na katapangan at pagtutol sa mga pahayagan ng Estados Unidos sa Pilipinas, ay ang partido kung saan naimpluwensiyahan ni Senator Claro M. Recto

Another	Odd	Couple
The	presidential	contest	to	succeed	Magsaysay	was	a	four-man	affair:	Carlos	P.
García,	a	Nacionalista	who	as	vice	president,	had	taken	over	the	presidency;
Manuel	Manahan,	former	customs	commissioner	and	a	Magsaysay	follower;
José	Yulo,	from	the	Liberal	Party;	and	Senator	Claro	M.	Recto,	the	head	of	the
Convention	that	had	drafted	the	1935	Constitution.	The	last	was	the	U.S.’s	bete
noire.	 Recto	 was	 an	 outspoken	 nationalist	 who	 had	 served	 in	 the	 pre-war
commonwealth

qa_pairs.question: What was the main economic policy implemented by President García?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: The Filipino First policy, which aimed to encourage Filipinos to engage in enterprises and industries vital to economic growth, stability, and security of the country, marked a significant shift towards nationalism and self-sufficiency, echoing the earlier policies of colonial-era William Howard Taft, but this time carried to its logical conclusion.

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang unang pagkilos ng administrasyon ni Macapagal sa pampulitika?
qa_pairs.answer: Ang pagpapaikli ng kontrol sa impormasyon at pamumuhunan
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Sa larangan ng ekonomiya, nagsimula si Macapagal ang dekontrol ng pag-importa at pag-sali ng mga kumpiskal upang mapabuti ang negosyo sa Pilipinas. Sa katunayan, ito ay isang mahahalagang hakbang upang magbigay-diin sa pag-ibon ng bansa at lumikha ng mga oportunidad para sa pangmatagtag na pag-unlad.

qa_pairs.question: Who was Ferdinand Marcos' wife, who became a powerful player in her own right?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Imelda Romualdez, the statuesque former beauty pageant queen from Tacloban City, capital of the Visayan island of Leyte, who leveraged her charm and charisma to become a key asset in Ferdinand Marcos' presidential campaign and later proved to be a significant figure in Philippine politics.

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang tungkulin ni Ferdinand Marcos sa pagpapalakas ng ekonomiya ng Pilipinas?
qa_pairs.answer: Siya ay nagsimula ng malawak na proyekto para sa kalsada at paaralan, subaybayan ng mga katanungan ng mga bisita mula sa ibang bansa.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang pagpapalakas ng ekonomiya ni Marcos ay hindi lang isang proyekto ng gobyerno, kundi isang hakbang upang mapahusay ang kapabilidad at tiwala ng mga Pilipino sa kanilang sarili.

qa_pairs.question: What was the name of the grandiose project initiated by Imelda Marcos?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: The Center of the Philippines, also known as CCP, was a grandiose project initiated by Imelda Marcos that showcased her ambition to be a national cultural force and zarina of the arts in the Philippines.
qa_pairs.context:
Center	of	the	Philippines	(CCP)	was	inaugurated.	It	was	Imelda’s	personal
project—the	first	of	many	grandiose	projects	she	would	undertake	in	her	long
political	career	and	for	which	she	was	sardonically	said	to	have	an	“edifice
complex.”	 At	 the	 festive	 opening	 ceremonies,	 California	 Governor	 Ronald
Reagan	and	his	wife	Nancy	were	Imelda’s	honored	guests,	beginning	a	special
relationship	that	would	immeasurably	benefit	the	Marcoses	during	the	martial-
law	era.	Critics	derided	the	Center	as

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang nangyari noong Setyembre 21, 1972?
qa_pairs.answer: Ang pag-atake sa kalaban ni Defense Secretary Juan Ponce Enrile.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang pag-atake sa kalaban ni Defense Secretary Juan Ponce Enrile, na tinutukoy bilang isang kasinungalingan at naging dahilan upang mag-deklara ng martial law sa ilalim ng administrasyon ni Presidente Ferdinand Marcos. Sa Pilipinas, ang pagpapakawalang-bahala sa kani-kanilang mga kaaway ay naging karaniwan na taktika ng gobyerno laban sa mga aktibista at oposisyon.
qa_pairs.context:
candidates	for	elections	scheduled	for	later	that	year.	The	outdoor	gathering	was
at	Plaza	Miranda,	Manila’s	Hyde	Park	and	a	historic	spot	for	rallies	of	all	sorts.
More	than	10,000	supporters	were	on	hand,	many,	no	doubt,	there	just	to	enjoy
the	palabas.	Two	fragmentation	grenades	were	lobbed	onto	the	stage	after	9	p.m.,
killing	a	five-year-old	child,	a	photographer,	and	seven	others.	Ninety-five	were
injured,	including	three	of	the	Liberal	candidates	and	the	candidate	for	the
mayoralty	of	Mani
